ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would tell them that it's a discussion class, and a good way to have questions answered about issues that are peripheral to science.I feel that not all speakers are equal, nor are content. Some speakers would prefer to talk for 45 minutes, while others are receptive to questions andattempt to engage students. Likewise, some material (e.g., grant process or patents) was very memorable and useful. Other material (e.g., lab dynamics) was fluffy, self-evident, and largely common sense.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I do not feel that this course made significant contributions to my understanding of my research. It did, however, enlighten me about things that are necessary for my research to be conducted (e.g., grants).
